meanings.definition: The state or quality of being knotty.
meanings.sent1: The knottinesses of the old tree trunk made it hard to carve.
meanings.sent2: The knottinesses of the rope made it challenging to untangle.
meanings.sent3: The knottinesses of the mystery novel kept the readers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: The knottinesses of the legal case required a skilled attorney to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The knottinesses of the puzzle added an extra layer of difficulty to solving it.

meanings.definition: The presence of knots or tangled parts.
meanings.sent1: The knottinesses in the wood gave the table a unique and rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The knottinesses in the fishing net caused it to get caught on rocks.
meanings.sent3: The knottinesses in the yarn made it challenging for the cat to play with.
meanings.sent4: The knottinesses in the garden hose led to water flow issues.
meanings.sent5: The knottinesses in the hair required extra care when combing it out.

meanings.definition: The complexity or difficulty of a situation.
meanings.sent1: The knottinesses of the math problem stumped the students for hours.
meanings.sent2: The knottinesses of the negotiation process delayed reaching an agreement.
meanings.sent3: The knottinesses of planning a surprise party without being caught were immense.
meanings.sent4: The knottinesses of the traffic jam caused frustration among the drivers.
meanings.sent5: The knottinesses of the relationship issues required open communication to resolve.
